intro: Sutherlandia, commonly known as cancer bush, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow or orange flowers. The plant contains various bioactive compounds, including alkaloids and flavonoids, which have been studied for their potential medicinal properties. Sutherlandia is often found in arid and semi-arid regions, growing on rocky soils and in open vegetation. Its leaves and stems are typically used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
